intro: Hedysarum alaschanicum, commonly known as the Altai milkvetch, is a perennial leguminous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects. Hedysarum alaschanicum is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which benefits surrounding vegetation.
